name: Thistle Marble Arch

reviews.text: This hotel is in a good location and has a great looking lobby. It also offers a wonderful buffet breakfast.
reviews.title: Noisy Hotel, Uncomfortable beds
Pleasant Stay, Convenient Location
reviews.text: Although the hotel appeared to be nice it had some major flaws. The hotel needs to better insulate the room doors. They close really loud. The beds are very uncomfortable. The bed I slept on slanted so much that I rolled off in the night. I gave up trying to stay on the bed and slept on the floor.

I stayed at the Thistle Marble Arch in May of 2006 and I was very pleased. It is located 1 block behind Oxford Street and is very convenient for the tube, buses and Oxford street shopping. It is also very close to Hyde Park. I had my passport stolen from my room at another hotel (the Marriott Maida Vale), and this hotel was very close to the American Embassy. The service was good, rooms comfortable and clean. I got a good rate on Priceline[-](USD 100).
reviews.title: Nice Place

reviews.text: I stayed here for 5 nights with a friend (twin room) on the 4th floor facing the street. It was a little noisy from the busses, but I had no problem sleeping. The room was clean, comfortable and included a table and 2 chairs, a desk and another chair, large wardrobe with a press, iron, and an ironing board. The location was great... Oxford street has a ton of shops and many restaurants. Bond street and the tube are a short walk away (tons of pubs and restaurants), and the Marble Arch tube is a short walk in the other direction. We had no problems getting around town on the tube or bus. We had no problems or complaints during our stay. The room was always clean when we returned and nothing was out of place. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely time, would stay here again
Laptop stolen!!!
reviews.text: Room: See pictures. Was given a room on 6th floor, not noisy, facing inside ac/unit area not street. Bed was fine and comfy. Room was big enough for London (stayed in MUCH smaller!). Furnishings were up to date and plesant. Loved our little couch where we could sit and talk or eat. Fridge was unfortuantely broken (called downstairs and was told they were all broken....what, how could that be?). Bathroom was nice and the toiletries were lemony/citrus and refreshing.

We were really impressed with the Thistle Marble Arch. For a central London hotel it has a very warm and friendly feel to it. All the staff we came into contact with were extremely helpful and pleasant. The room was a good size; very clean and comfortable. There was quite a queue for breakfast on the Sunday morning, but it moved swiftly and the breakfast was worth waiting for - wonderful selection of Full English or Continental. Looking forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for the weekend with my daughter. what a lovely hotel with fantastic staff.
reviews.title: BRILLIANT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most comfortable bed I have ever had in a hotel..
reviews.title: Service with a smile

reviews.text: Breakfast was so much choice and ever so helpful waiting staff.
reviews.title: Thistle do me

reviews.text: Very impressed over all will certainly stay again next time I'm in London
reviews.title: Excellent Weekend Stay

reviews.text: Nice lobby. Clean. Quiet rooms. We arrived before check in and had not slept on the plane. They got our room ready and let us check in by 11:30. Thank you !! This hotel is walking distance from Oxford St ., close to the underground and Hyde park.
reviews.title: Interesting Hotel

reviews.text: I recently returned back from doing a tour of the UK and i stayed briefly at the Thistle Marble Arch in London and found it to be one of the most welcoming hotels i have ever visted , right from the start i was impressed with its coustmer service to the food the rooms to the most friendly welcoming manner the staff have and are always on hand to help you with any issue ......
reviews.title: Vanessa D

reviews.text: I would highly recommend the chicken ceaser salad at the Lounge Bar including the ambience it provides with the friendley staff it makes it a wonderful experience .
reviews.title: Good location Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you everyone at the Thistle Marble Arch :-)
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for one night in a family room, the room very large but the furniture was dated and could with an upgrade. Breakfast was a good selection and great hot coffee, although the hot food could be hotter. I asked for some herbal tea bags late in the evening and was told I couldn't have any! I then asked in the restaurant and was offered English breakfast.
reviews.title: Great stay
Never go for an upgrade
reviews.text: They have changed the "upgrade" deal from 20 pounds per night per room into a hefty 55 pounds per night per room, nominally adding a "business lounge" access with free Internet, free snacks and free drinks, as well as a cocktail hour.

At this lounge we found that there was no snack, and no "finger food" that were promised when booking the upgrade. The staff very reluctantly ordered the finger food from the room service which took half an hour. The food wasn't too bad, but I don't think guests have to order finger food and wait for half an hour for finger food.
reviews.title: Marvelous Marble Arch

reviews.text: There were many many glitches with the upgrade. I think they are not used to it and that may be the reason why my upgrade was a disaster, and no one is as stupid as me to add 55 pounds a night. A two-star hotel cannot give you a four-star service just because you pay 55 pounds more. It was an illusion and I was stupid, and because they saw that I was stupid, I was talked into this upgrading fiasco.
reviews.title: Some good, some bad

reviews.text: Having said that, all the cleaning staff, porters, waitresses and maids were all very nice! The more white-collar the staff, the less friendly, less helpful. This made me think of the profound inequality and injustice in this society.
reviews.title: No problems here..great deal for the price

reviews.text: I may stay at this hotel again if Priceline gives me an incredible deal. But I will never upgrade again....
reviews.title: Watch yourself!

reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights via a last minute BA package booking; We had a fabulous room for the entire family -- a suite like room with two sides and two double beds in each (#845) - Must be the biggest room in the place! (I think it is one of the bigger ones b/c we checked the fire-escape map and it was definitely 2x the regular size) While it was a little bit of a hike from the elevator (200 steps to be exact) it was well worth it!
reviews.title: Great Room, Great Location
The Location and Price can't be beat
reviews.text: They were so kind to accomodate to our need to check in early b/c we were travelling with our children who are 3 and 5. And the housekeeping staff lovingly made their beds each day with their lovies streched out on their pillows waiting for their return.

reviews.title: Wouldn't stay again
reviews.text: The kids loved the room and the breakfast -- while it is definitely a business hotel, as a family we found it very comfortable and generally good. I would recommend eating on the restaurant side rather than the conference room for a.m b-fast because the atmosphere is nicer. Plus there were lots of amenities (sainsbury local, selfridges, etc) close by and the short walk to the tube station was very convenient.

Sunday a.m. was crowded but the other days were quite pleasant and the staff was very helpful even with 2 jumpy children in tow. On day 2, when my son threw up right in front of the restaurant in the hotel lobby,while I was mortified, the staff was exceptionally helpful -- I could see the look of horror on their faces but they were grinning and bearing it with obvious tact and grace!
reviews.title: Good location - average hotel
Priceline is Great
reviews.text: The b-fast was good, but if it weren't included in my package, I probably wouldn't have induldged in it every day as it wasn't exceptional (there must be a lack of desire for cream in ones coffee in England b/c they kept serving me milk with my coffee?)

Tucked away behind the Marble Arch end of Oxford Street this hotel is in a great location for shopping and the park. Marble Arch tube station is just around the corner, with Bond Street station a short walk away down Oxford Street. Staff are invariably polite and friendly, the public areas are spacious and well-maintained and the rooms are clean and spacious. Breakfast choice is excellent. Definitely recommended.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: London is absolutely lovely. My accommodations were wonderful. I felt comfortable and safe at the Thistle Marble Arch. I must give my appreciation to Raymond F. and Mark at the Marmor Grill. These gentlemen made me feel more like family visiting instead of like a stranger. As a result of such excellent service, I had most of my meals at the Marmor. Thank you guys for such a wonderful time in London, and adding to the memories of my first trip to London.
reviews.title: First Visit

reviews.text: On arrival, I was treated as a 'special guest', whisked through the check in procedure and shown every thing that would help me as a wheelchair user. As this was my first (and solo) visit to London since becoming disabled I had quite a few reservation as to how I would cope. I need not have worried. The entire visit was 'First Class'. Checking in and out was simple, and the breakfast staff could not have been bettered. On leaving, the concierge when above and beyond in arranging my taxi etc.
reviews.title: First class for the disabled
Weekend in London
reviews.text: If you are disabled, then I could not recommend the Thistle Marble Arch higher. You will not be failed.

We were staying at Thistle Marble Arch last weekend in October. The hotel was nice and clean, breakfast was delicious, staf were very friendly. Our room was spacious and clean but bathroom was a little bit outdated. I also didn't like the queue for the breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at many 4* hotels in London and thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay at The Thistle. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. We paid extra for a larger room on the 4th floor and it was a nice size room with good quality furniture and a huge comfy bed. Breakfast offered a really great choice. Of course the biggest plus for this hotel is its absolute central location. If we had one negative it was the fact that there seems to be only one bank of lifts on each floor and our room location was a very long walk from the lifts! That said, we will definitely return and only wish we had stayed there before now!
reviews.title: First stay at this hotel

reviews.text: I had to stay because I missed my train ( had a few drinks!) I was not expecting that charge especially at it was the last moment thing. The room was on the 8th floor, right next to a massive air con duct.
reviews.title: £286 to book a BB at 12.20 am

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not even a bottle of water in the rather shabby room. This room must be reserved for people like me who don't have a choice.
reviews.title: cannot wait to go again!

reviews.text: The lobby area looks nice, but that's where it ends.
reviews.title: best Hotel One can ever think of staying in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I felt like they had ripped me off.
reviews.title: Nice and central stay

reviews.text: Got a 12 night stay here for US$53 per night - got it on Priceline.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: No problems at check-in, very polite staff, no questions about Priceline and no questions about the upgrade.
reviews.title: Just fine - some problems but good overall

reviews.text: Room was big for London standards, nice big fluffy towels and very powerful hot water. Bed was comfortable. My room was a very long walk from the lifts, but not a real problem.
reviews.title: perfectly adequate
Very good value
reviews.text: Location was superb - I have been to London many times and this is the best located hotel I've ever been. Staff were helpful and top-grade. The concierges were very knowledgable - two of them have the Clefs d'Or.
Definitely stay there again given the chance - especially for $53/night on priceline.
reviews.title: Uncomfortable beds

description: Thistle Marble Arch hotel, located just off Oxford Street, takes its name from one of London’s best-known landmarks. Originally built on the Mall as a new gateway to Buckingham Palace, the Arch remains an exclusive thoroughfare as only members of the royal family and the King's Troop, Royal Horse Artillery, are allowed to pass through it.As the name implies, the Arch is made from Italian white Carrara marble, a favourite material of the Art Deco movement in the 1920s and 30s, when Thistle Marble Arch was built. Today, the hotel is one of the few genuine Art Deco buildings left in London.It is also one of the few larger Oxford Street hotels with 692 bedrooms, including 281 deluxe and executive rooms and Suites. We also have our own Just Gym workout facilities on-site, an alternative to a brisk stroll around nearby Hyde Park.
